title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Put a large saucepan of water on to boil.
Finely chop the pancetta, having first removed any rind.
Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper and set everything aside.
Add the spaghetti to the water and cook following pack instructions.
Squash the garlic with the blade of a knife, just to bruise it.
Melt the butter in a frying pan and, when it starts to foam, tip in the pancetta and garlic.
Leave to cook on a medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until the pancetta is golden and crisp.
Remove from the heat and discard the garlic.
Save a cup of the pasta water, then drain the spaghetti and tip it into the frying pan with the pancetta.
Mix most of the cheese in with the eggs, keeping a small handful back for sprinkling over later.
Quickly pour in the eggs and cheese, lifting up the spaghetti so it mixes easily.
Add extra pasta cooking water to keep it saucy if necessary.
Serve immediately with a little sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper.

title: Chicken Curry
instructions: Chop the chicken into bite-sized pieces and set aside.
Finely chop the onions, garlic, and ginger.
Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the onions and cook until golden brown.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder and cook for another minute.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned all over.
Pour in the tomatoes and chicken stock and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat and cook for 20-25 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the yogurt and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.
